column1: On one of her voyages from China
column6: a young tiger. He appeared to be as harmless and playful as a kitten
column7: and allowed the utmost familiarity from every one. He was especially fond of creeping into the sailors' hammocks; and while he lay stretched on the deck
column8: he would suffer two or three of them to place their heads on his back
column9: as upon a pillow. Now and then
column11: he would at dinner-time run off with pieces of their meat; and though sometimes severely punished for the theft
column12: he bore the chastisement he received with the patience of a dog. His chief companion was a terrier
column13: with whom he would play all sorts of tricks—tumbling and rolling over the animal in the most amusing manner
column14: without hurting it. He would also frequently run out on the bowsprit
column15: and climb about the rigging with the agility of a cat.
